Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Han_manchester Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and i stayed at the hotel on Easter Weekend. On arrival at the hotel the Front Desk staff were so helpful and friendly and gave us lots of great information about the hotel and its services. We arrived at 10.30 to be swiftly given our room to our delight as check in is normally 3pm. The room was basic but with great decor and very clean. The show was a great size and always warm. The Services the hotel provided were second to none and never seemed to much trouble. We asked the Front desk staff on a number of occasion about how to get to places and what they recommended, they spent time and effort showing us maps and drawing us diagrams. The hotel is in an exellent location, right in the heart of everything, We walked everywhere as everything was in walking distant. The roof top terrace is cute and gives you a great view. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit barcelona on a budget. Its exellent and well worth the £190 for two nights price tag. We will be staying again im sure :0)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel located in the Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Klinf
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located in the Gothic Quarter, very near the main attractions of this district. Also close to the Ramblas and Parc de la Ciutadella. The room has a good size and it is clean and comfortable. The bathroom is excellent. The breakfast at the hotel is excellent, but is not included in the room rate. It has free wi-fi and mineral water, in a cooler outside the room, in the hallway. The staff are courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for weekend away”
Reviews.Author: F0xymummy
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault this hotel. It was clean, modern and the staff were extremely helpful - especially those on reception. Even when we had a problem with our first room they quickly resolved it and then gave us the biggest room in the hotel. One of the nicest features was having free chilled bottle water available on every floor - that's a really nice touch! Also liked the roof terrace area. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in the Gothic area of Barcelona - right in the heart of it. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and modern”
Reviews.Author: wellhamsrus
Reviews.Content: A very clean and modern hotel in a good location, within walking distance of museums, shopping and eating districts and parks, and convenient to the metro. Staff were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: AG77Lagos
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 months old baby and myself stayed for 3 nights in this fantastic hotel. The location is just perfect: sights and lots of restaurants nearby, the harbour and more restaurants as well as Plaza Catalunya -10 minutes away walking distance. The decoration is very modern, but simple, so very pleasant. The room (307) was very spacious and more than enough playroom for our little boy. It faced the street (Carrer Princesa) and it was very quiet (the double glazing of the doors is very effective). It was just a little bit too hot in the room and it seemed that we were not able to control it from the room. The receptionists were all very efficient and gave us all the information requested (good restaurants, how to get to places and also helped with booking the taxi to the airport). Fantastic coffee at breakfast (freshly ground coffee – how rare is that!!!!) and the buffet was also very abundant (eggs, bacon, muesli, fresh fruit, great yogurt, cakes, etc….). Nice and original touch: free water bottles in the hallway! Would certainly come back and recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kadavis2
Reviews.Content: This is actually the first review I've written on TripAdvisor. I use it all the time to help make my travel plans and I thought it was time to give back to the community. This hotel blew me away.The hotel was in a great location. There as a small wine store right down the street that had 1.5 liters of barrel wine for 2 euros. The hotel itself was very modern. That is a trait I like in the hotels I stay in. The bed was comfortable and the room was a decent size (for Europe standards). The absolute best perk that you would probably not even think was that great, was the cooler of free bottled water on each floor. They keep it well stocked and the water is awesome. This alone saved me ten to fifteen euros each day. Also, having free WiFi available in each room was a big plus. I'd recommend this to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: spacetrace
Reviews.Content: We have now visited Barcelona 7 times and this is the only hotel we have returned to. For us the location is perfect; not too touristy, very safe (although in Barcelona you should always be aware of pickpockets), close to El Born & the beautiful churches of the Barri Gotic. The pool is also a great place to enjoy the sunshine and relax, or take food up and eat at the seating areas. The rooms are well designed, with nice juliet balconies overlooking the street, but the room we had was a bit worn with scuffs on the wall and a shower that needed re-grouted. These are small issues for us because the hotel was very good value and in the right location. I would suggest that because the street is noisy it would be wise to take earplugs; the street noise didn't bother my partner at all but I was woken up a couple of times. The staff at the front desk were very nice, as were the cleaning staff, and they gave us maps and advice on eating out. My only complaint is that I asked twice for the shower head to be cleaned as it was badly clogged, but this didn't happen during our 5 night stay. Other than that, we had no issues and we would be happy to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Maria Eduarda M
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that i made this choice. Clean, great location, really friendly staff, water for free. What else do you want? :)

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Spain 2012”
Reviews.Author: SoCalPirtle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the PERFECT location! The rooms are spacious and clean. When we first arrived, we asked for a "nice" room, and they gave us a room on the 5th floor in the back with one window facing a small crawl space (Clean but no view). There were two twin beds and we wanted a single bed to share so we called down to the front desk to see if they could change the beds, and they said no problem and changed our room immediately. Our new room was #310. We went to go and check it out, and to our surprise we were in the front of the building with an awesome balcony! It overlooked the street and everything that was going on was right there!!! They have free bottled water at the end of every hallway, and two computers with internet on the 1st floor (FREE). I would highly recommend this place to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Gourmet hotel in Osttirol”
Reviews.Author: 5Kontinente
Reviews.Content: Ein tolles, kleines Hotel in Osttirol/ Kartitsch.Die Zimmer sind im ländlichen österreichischem Stil eingerichtet, mit viel Holz.Es gibt eine Minibar. Das Badezimmer mit Waschbecken und Dusche ausgestattet. Der Spabereich ist ganz neu, wunderschön, mit einer finnischen Sauna, Dampfsauna und einer Infrarotkabine, und einem großzügigem Ruheraum.Auch Massagen werden angeboten. Das Frühstück ist reichhaltig,Müsli, Wurst, Käse, Marmeladen, und man kann Eier in verschiedensten Variationen bestellen. Aber das wunderbarste an diesem Hotel ist das Abendessen, welches mit viel Kreativität zubereitet wird.Andre der Herr des Hauses ist ein Sommelier, und ist mit den besten Weinen ausgestattet. Wir besuchten dieses Haus schon zum dritten mal, und waren wieder sehr zufrieden.

Reviews.Title: “clean, basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: We took aerobus number A2 for €5.30 one way from airport to the main bus stop & walked to hotel- its about 1mile or so away so it's do-able with little luggage. Location is down a side street about 10-15mins walk from La Rambla & close to the Cathedral & the site seeing bus. Although hotel is not on main street there are lots of little shops, tapas bar & super markets next to it, they are not so touristy & loud. Hotel is also a short walk to the zoo & park- the park is beautiful. Hotel is simple, clean & basic- we stayed in room 101-would not recommend if u are light sleeper, it was next to elevator & can hear it going up & down, however this was never a bother for us. Bed is just 2 single bed put together & due to laminate flooring, the bed kept sliding around. Mattress is terrible you can feel all the springs! Amenities are basic 3 towels, 1 shampoo& cond, shower gel, soap & shower cap. Despite being basic, it's a nice little hotel. Breakfast is good, there was a range of hot & cold food, we went between 9am-10am for breakfast & there was always food Nice little hotel would recommend but only if ur staying for wkend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lpip60
Reviews.Content: My friend and I picked this place without a lot of research, as we moved out of our original accomodations nearby. What a great surprise. The location was perfect. The hotel wasn't cheap but seemed to be a better value than the other places we looked into (it was a long holiday weekend so rates were on the high end). The rooms were small but super clean and very nicely furnished, and the bathrooms were extremely large for Europe, with a shower that actually kept the water in the tub. The most pleasant surprise was the very friendly and helpful staff (particularly Reuben, who went to great pains to help us with a couple of different issues). The only possible drawback is that it fronts a busy street, so ask for a room on the back side if you are a light sleeper. I look forward to returning to Barcelona and will definitely stay here when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: g_buckley3
Reviews.Content: Good location within easy reach of La Rambles and other attractions.Room was comfortable and clean with excellent shower.There was a good choice at breakfast..We found all the staff to be friendly and very helpfull with any queries we had.The rooftop area was great for sitting and relaxing.We would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Cannot fault anything”
Reviews.Author: q l
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, comfortable, friendly and helpful staff, perfect location right in the middle of Barri Gotic where all the delicious tapas places are, and an awesome rooftop pool area - great price to top it all off. The guy that does the afternoon shift gave some excellent local restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Superb staff. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ZippyNZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Easy work from Juane I metro. Easy to find. Excellent staff. Very clean, well appointed rooms. Fabulous location. Ten minute walk from La Rambles where you can enjoy an oversized beer or Sangria. Although we were overwhelmed with warnings re pickpockets and petty theft, by taking common sense precautions we encountered no troubles. Roof top pool area well worth a visit at night (superb views). The high calibre of the staff made this hotel memorable. This hotel was worth paying a few extra Euros for it's location,comfort, security and service. In fact we extended our stay by a night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Nikcheh
Reviews.Content: We tried different hotels in Barcelona as we were traveling back & forth & wanted to stay in different neigjbourhoods. This one was by far the BEST one. Great lication (by el born), very friendly, quite clean & excellent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Nickynacky1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in Barcelona, the hotel was in a fabulous location. Lots of small shops and restaurants close by. The location of the hotel allows you to wander to La Ramblas in about 15 mins. Close enough to the heart of everything but far enough away to be safe and quiet. The hotel is very modern and clean. The staff are very friendly and will help with any questions. A little thing, we asked for another pillow each and they were in our room within 10mins. We stayed bed and breakfast and the breakfast a buffet style breakfast, was well worth the little extra we paid. There is a large selection of cold meats bread and cheese. A choice of cereals or bacon, scrambled egg and sausage all cooked fresh and topped up at regular intervals. Fresh juice and coffee. There is a very nice roof top terrace with a pool and sun beds, a lovely view of the roof tops of the city. All in all a fabulous stay and will certainly return to Barcelona and this hotel Thank you to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: FizzyJazzle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing in this beautiful city, both on foot and using public transport, which for me was the clincher. My first impression of the street was that I would not want to walk alone late in the evening, but we were never out too late and it was never deserted, so this was not a problem. Having said that, little streets leading out from it made it ideal for pickpocketing and we actually witnessed a pickpocket making his escape. There was an old man who frequently loitered at the end of the road, flashing unsuspecting women, but he was not threatening and nobody took any notice of him. The hotel Reception had friendly and polite staff. I would describe the room as functional rather than cosy, but it was clean and modern, with a good shower. On the minus side, we had a room facing the interior - the window looked out onto a small quadrangle and a view of the walls and windows of the rooms opposite so there was hardly any natural light. The walls were thin, meaning that you could hear the comings and goings in the hallway and any sounds coming from the neighbouring rooms. The beds were rather firm. I cannot decide whether ours was double room or twin room because we had two single beds pushed together and made up separately; too close to be a twin arrangement, but I imagine not ideal for a honeymooning couple. There was also very little space for storing clothes if you were staying for longer than a few days - no shelves or drawers (and I had to ask for extra hangers, as there were only 3 in the wardrobe), which meant that anything that could not be hung up would have to be kept in your case. Although CNN and BBC were supposedly available we were unable to get these channels on the TV (I wanted to tune into the news), but this was not a problem - who goes to Barcelona to watch TV? Anyway, guests had free WiFi and two PCs at their disposal on the first floor. We did not take breakfast at the hotel - at €11,50 per person we thought it a bit steep - but there are plenty of other options in the area. There was no fridge in the room but it was nice to have a free supply of water in the fridge at the end of the corridor, and you were able - at your own risk - to use it to refrigerate your own drinks. The rooftop terrace and pool would be the ideal place to wind down after a day of sightseeing, although we didn't use it. It has to be said that it is very small and I imagine it would quickly become crowded in high season. It's also a pity that there is no bar on the terrace. Finally, we appreciated the fact that we could leave our luggage at the hotel when we checked out to enjoy our last hours in Barcelona unhindered before making our way to the airport. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for a short city trip. I would actually give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mikeonair
Reviews.Content: This is a new, modern style hotel in a very old part of Barcelona. The design is spacious and minimal, without being uncomfortable. The service staff were youthful, friendly and helpful, and generally spoke good English, and the place as a whole felt pretty secure. The room we had was a handy size, with good bathroom facilities, and you had the added bonus of a free supply of water-bottles in a dedicated fridge at the end of the corridor. A help-yourself breakfast is served in the canteen-style restaurant on the ground floor, with a reasonable selection of food and drink. For many people the real selling-point of the location is the close proximity to the Passeig del Born, with lots of great restaurants and bars - and the Picasso Museum - close at hand. If you ever get sick of exploring new parts of this fascinating city, there is a (small) pool on the roof, along with a few deck chairs, for just sitting around...

Reviews.Title: “Great start to the honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jennyleevickerman
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel situated in the old town with little boutiques and alley ways that lead off each other for a little mini adventure. The room was quite spacious and the bathroom was clean, we also had a balcony that looked over the street, it was not noisy at all. The hotel doesn't have a bar, but there is a Japanese and peruvian restaurant, which I would have loved to try but we were only staying 3 nights and there were many pinxto (local for bread style tapas) places to each. One about 5 mins walk away. The hotel is about 15 mins walk to the ramblas area for good shopping and more pinxto restaurant and fresh oysters. A couple of downsides to the hotel and that would be the roof top area with pool doesn't have that many sun loungers and the pool is quite small. It also closes about 9 if I remember quite rightly. And the breakfast is good for the continental however if you want sausage, bacon and scrambled eggs best get there before 930, as much of the hot food goes even though breakfast is on till 11. All in all I would return to the hotel when I get to go back to Barcelona and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: rgreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cuitat Barcelona for 3 nights at the end of June. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was fantastic right in the heart of the old quarter surrounded by gorgeous boutiques and opposite an amazing ice cream shop. Although it was central, we did not find it noisy and slept very well all 3 nights. The pool is perfect for cooling off. We loved the continental breakfast it gave us a healthy start to the day and was plentiful. We would definately recommend this hotel and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, good location.”
Reviews.Author: SJperth_8
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Barcelona (gothic quarter) for exploring, large rooms (for European standards), clean, newly refurbished & balcony. Wifi, complimentary bottled water & pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - some flaws”
Reviews.Author: vienna-onthemove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ciutat Barcelona for three nights in June 11. First: the location is great for exploration of Barcelona. Carrer Princesa is a nice street, right in the center of the old town, close to important museums, sights and many nice squares with little bars and restaurants. The streets in front of the hotel (towards the port) are a bit more upmarket, with artsy little shops and restaurants, while the streets behind the hotel have a much more local and neighborhood feel. The location allows you to walk most of Barcelona (Barceloneta: 20 mins, Cathedral: 10 mins). But if you need a Metro, the Jaume I station is just 5 minutes away. The hotel itself is in a renovated old building, as it seems and has a nice roof terrace with a little pool. The rooms are quite small, and have a bit of a youth hostel flair. A bit too minimalistic... Our room was quite dark and had a window into a very small inner courtyard. If the window would be left open, the room would smell of kitchen fumes. At night you could hear the neighbors snore. AC was not yet swiched on, but outside temperature was hovering only around 20, so it was not really required. Bathrooms are OK, shower good. The soundproofing to the hallway is horrible. You can hear every single word or movement in the hallway. Unfortunately, the beds are also a nuisance. Spring mattraces with a sag in the middle. After three nights, I was feeling ready for physio... Nice touch: every floor has a big fridge with free bottles of water, where you can replenish your minerals. The hotel has a restaurant (Peruvian-Japanese) which we did not try, but it was alsways quite busy unitl late. We had breakfast there, which was a perfectly agreeable buffet, with pastry, eggs, juices, cold cuts, and the likes... All in all: the hotel is a bit of a mixed bag... Location is great, rooms not so. Value for money is so-so. I found it a bit to expensive for what it offered in terms of quality.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely recommandable!”
Reviews.Author: bib1970
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the "Born", few steps to Plaça Santa Maria, to Catedral, to the Ramblas, to the Port... rooms are small but very clean...ask for a room to the backyard if you don't like the fiestas at night ;-) nice little pool on the rooftop.. breakfast for 11€ not really a sensual experience but there are many terraces close to the hotel which have a good choice of breakfast.. Would definately come back to the Ciutat de Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Perkos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first trip to Barcelona and loved the great location - walking distance to many great sites, tapas & LaRambla. Rooms are modern & clean but basic - no tea making facitilies or fridge!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a the old city”
Reviews.Author: rudy-lou
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as our first stop in Europe based on the information provided by Trip Advisor. The hotel is very clean, quite and in an excellent part of the old city within easy walking distance to La Ramblas, Marina and the Barcelona Zoo. All of the reception staff speak english and I was most impressed by a lovely Brazilian Gentleman (sadley didn't get his name) that checked us in and gave some excellent ideas on where to eat and what is a definate must see in Barcelona. You must try Komoto restuarant attached to the hotel the food is excellent! Only down side the mattress was way to firm for our liking

Reviews.Title: “The facilities are very good and the staff were very helpful and poilte”
Reviews.Author: LucanBohs
Reviews.Content: This is a well located Hotel, within easy reach of all the major attractions, due to the close proximity of the Metro. It also a short walk from the Picasso Museum. The facilities are very good and the staff were very helpful and poilte. The rooftop terrace and pool were excellent and different from other hotels. The shower in the room was "full on" and very refreshing! Two minor gripes, room wasn't soundproofed, lots of street noise and tea/coffee making facilities would be welcome. The Breakfast buffet was expensive @ €11, so we ate elsewhere. While most reviews mentioned crime, we found little evidence of it in the local area. However it does pay to be vigilant, as in any major city criminals are always on the lookout for easy targets.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Helpful Staff, Modern & clean”
Reviews.Author: Carmen1401
Reviews.Content: I spent the New Year’s vacation at the Ciutat Hotel de Barcelona, it was a very nice stay, the room was clean, the staff members are helpful, the location is very nice, and it is walking minutes away from the Cathedral de Barcelona & the gothic quarter. You can easily get to the famous Plaça de Catalunya, la Rambla Street, and to the Port Vell. There are a lot of bars (el Born Street) and restaurants next to the hotel. If you are looking for a cheap breakfast, you can find a nearby cafe name Cappuccino. The hotel also provides free internet access, and free water. I would recommend this hotel for everyone looking for a good location hotel, with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: goddess1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is slightly more expensive than it should be for the amenities (we paid about 150 Euro). However, the location in the Barri Born district is so perfect and convenient to just about everything in the old seciton of Barcelona. Plus, there's a metro stop a couple of blocks away, which will get you everywhere in this city. We bought a 20 euro metro/bus pass good for 4 days and we used it to go just about everywhere. The room is spartan, but extremely clean. The wifi connection is great, plus there's a small business center for those who don't travel with their laptops. The pool was okay, but very small. I imagine it's much more of an attraction in the heat of the summer than in the fall, when we traveled.The breakfact isn't included in the price of the room, and at 10 Euro, it's really very expensive, considering there are so many great little cafes and coffee shops right out the front door. We found the staff very helpful, although some were not as friendly as they should have been.If you decide to come here, do request a room with a window looking out on Caller de Princesa. Our room was in the back...quiet but very dark!

Reviews.Title: “Groovy hotel in a groovy location”
Reviews.Author: msrobski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 separate occasions and loved it. The rooms are very contemporary, the bathrooms are good, breakfast is excellent and they have free bottled water in fridges on every floor. It's in an excellent location in a very cool neighbourhood and only a few minutes walk from a metro station. If you wan atmosphere ask for a street view room although it's a bit noisy at night. The second time we stayed there we had a room that looked onto a central lightwell / void and although not as light or atmospheric, it was very quiet. Everyone at reception speaks excellent English and are helpful although not particularly friendly. The rooftop pool is great after a hard days' sightseeing and there's a gelato shop right across the road! The only issue we had was that the electricity kept going off and on. Not sure why. And as with all the hotels we stayed in, no iron!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, beds a little uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: oxcat90
Reviews.Content: I would gladly stay here again - the hotel itself whilst being down quite a narrow street was in a brilliant location. In terms of restaurants and great unique shops it was right in the middle of everything, and only a few minutes from the nearest metro and tourist bus stops. The hotel itself was pretty good, fairly modern and with a roof terrace and miniature swimming pool, and the room was ok. It was a bit dark and the beds were a bit hard but totally manageable. The shower also had variable temperatures and required a bit of hopping in and out, but the hotel supplied bottled water for all the guests which was a nice touch. Receptionist spoke English and gave us out helpful maps and info. Perfection is possibly not the word, but it's a pretty good hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “We spent 3 nights here. Location is...”
Reviews.Author: Snorkeller02
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here. Location is brilliant, just 2 min walk from the busy squares and street and 20 min walk to beach. It is what it is - a great 3 star. There is no bar or tea and coffee making facilities in room, but there is a fridge packed with complimentary bottles of water on each floor. A variety of people stay here from couples, friends to families. Great atmosphere. not busy or crazy or impersonal like the feeling that I get the I go to big hotels. Check out Taller de Tapas in Placa Sant Josef. Great food and service. Worth queuing to get a table. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but to expensive”
Reviews.Author: PerDenmark
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice small pool...... But we had to pay 200 € a night for a tripple room without breakfast. The room (106) was an OK double room, but too small for three beds. It was on the first floor directly on the street, meaning that everybody on the street looked directly into the room, through the big windows, which couldn't be opened. When making the reservation we asked for a room with at balcony - but didn't succed. When asking the staff (and the manager) to have a room with a balcony or a pricereduction we wore told - in a very unfriendly way - that this was a standard room and that was the price in Barcelona. We will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet location but close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: SandraB015
Reviews.Content: Found this little hotel as a result of a search and read the reviews. Great location for the city and the port area. Rooms, whilst 'sparse', are modern, clean and more importantly, quiet!. If you are visiting Barcelona you are only in the room to sleep and get ready to go out and explore this facinating city. Reception staff are very helpfull and the supply of free bottled water is just a very nice touch. We did not take breakfast in our deal as there are loads of little bars/cafes nearby. The rooftop pool is a perfect place to chill before heading out for the evening. We will be back at this hotel on our next trip to Barcelona and I would have no hesitation recommending it you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Patrick G
Reviews.Content: My wife and i traveled to Barcelona and picked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and got exactly what we were hoping for in location but got much more than we expected for service.... the hotel is a short, historic walk to Las Ramblas and near the bus and subway routes to everywhere else. Its also a short walk to the port too... there is a cooler at the end of each hall with free bottled water which was needed since we were on our feet the whole day. the room is clean and basic. you have a safe and a good size bathroom with basic toiletries and daily maid service. comfortable king bed. there is a restaurant that serves breakfast and dinner but we didnt try it... there is some incredible food in cafes and tapas bars just down the street. now the service... the staff did everything they should have from check-in to check-out... they answered the phones politely and knew english since my spanish is very bad. they are also your concierge and suggested local cafes and what we must do and what would be nice should we fit it in. they were helpful all the way. now here is where good service went from good to great. my wife and i were sunbathing on the pool deck and i wanted to take a picture. when i took the camera out of the case, my wife had also put her watch in it. when i took the camera out the watch came out and fell on the deck and between the slats. i had resigned myself that i had to buy my wife a new watch but i mentioned it to the front desk. initially, he though i meant my room key, but when a lady at the desk translated watch he said "ohhhhh.........show me". he followed me up to the top and i pointed it out. he moved a few sun loungers and opened a door, squeezed his way down through air ducts, and crawled his way to the watch and brought it back. we thanked him and he disappeared like it was nothing, maybe it wasn't much to him, but it was a lot to us.... when we return, we'll be back because the staff care you have a great time in barcelona and at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar location and attentive staff. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: cpedge78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during a recent tour of Spain and Italy. We stayed at 6 hotels during our travels and both agree that the Ciutat stood out among the group for its helpful staff and overall value. Located just blocks from a Metro station and great dining/drinking areas, this hotel is a great home base for experiencing the great city of Barcelona. The breakfast was a welcome suprise, as we did not notice it at the time of booking. The pool area on the roof was a nice touch, as well, and was enjoyed on a beautiful sunny afternoon after a long day exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal location for business district, but what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Burywood
Reviews.Content: I arrived with mixed feelings. Not located very close to where I was doing business. But quickly changed to a very positive experience with great staff, great bar and really comfy bed (oh, and the best shower ever) (but no bath). Fantastic location and try the Tapas bar at the top of Carrer de Montcada.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mastani599
Reviews.Content: All I can say is: WOW. This hotel was by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. It was clean, modern, beautiful, had a very friendly staff who went out of their way to help us (especially Ana!), and much, much more. The location was amazing - not loud as it would be had we stayed on Las Ramblas, but on a perfect street close enough to everything so you can walk anywhere pretty easily. The metro is also one block away, so it's very accessible. And we would've never found this amazing street that the hotel was on (La Princesa) had we not stayed here. I will most definitely be staying here if I ever come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect experience in Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Vrachka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona in the late summer and had a great overal experience. The hotel's location is perfect; some 3 minutes from Jaume I tube station (which meant that we took a train from the airport which took us straight here, although you'll have to be careful that you board the right train as the system is slightly confusing), equal distance from the lovely Gothic quarter and pretty much opposite the Picasso museum and an area with plenty of good restaurants and bars. Not only that but the hotel is perfectly positioned for all other numerous Barcelona attractions in particular if you like to explore the city on foot. 30 minute walk took us to the beach and some 10 minute walk took us to La Ramba. We could even walk to Sagrada familia. The hotel itself is almost perfect. I say almost because it does have one notable fault; very thin internal walls. Having said that, this was not a significant problem for us. The hotel has numerous very positive points; spacious and comfortable rooms, free bottled water, free internet access for guest, a nice and varied breakfast served in a quirky restaurant that turns into Japanese restaurant at night and a charming pool and relax area on the roof-top. Add to this a very reasonable rate and helpful staff and you've got an almost perfect experience. I would certainly come back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location and excellent value. Would recommend it and look forward to returning in the summer.”
Reviews.Author: LondonLales Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location and excellent value. Would recommend it and look forward to returning in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Stina09
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is great! The hotel is in a very nice area of Barcelona with lots of nice bars nearby. The room was new and very clean, the staff was friendly - and check out the roofterrace - the view is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “nice location disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: agnieszkamac
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of friends for the extended weekend. Location is perfect, picasso museum just around the corner. The hotel looks very modern inside, and pretty much like on the hotel web site. The first room my husband and I were put in was quite small overlooking the back street, which made the room pretty dark. It had a nice spacy bathroom. However, there were two single beds (rather narrow). We tried to put them together but it did not work on the slippy panel floor and we were drifted apart in the night. Therefore we asked for the new room, and the second one was a real disaster. Tiny bathroom, and a room with one very narrow window facing the internal little piece of nowhere which made the room very very dark. There was completely no day light in this room. I was fed up and disappointed but since it was a weekend stay I did not want to move for the third time. My friends stayed in the rooms facing the Pincessa street. The rooms looked bigger and moreover they had huge windows and nice balconies. However, in one of them, there was this terrible smell from sewage system in the bathroom which we heard is a common problem with hotels in old Barcelona buildings. I love Barcelona, and come back, but not to Ciutat de Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in lovely part of old town with extremely friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kath70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a one week trip to Barcelona. From our first dealings with the staff in this hotel to our final check out a week later our experience was excellent. The reception desk e mailed us with details of the best way to get to hotel - we used Aerobus to Catalunya then cab to hotel ( 5 euro! ) You could easily walk it but it was 9 30 pm and we took the easy route! Reception guy , Reuben, I think, met our cab welcomed us at door and booked us in quickly and efficiently. We collected a couple of bottles of water, freely available on every floor, and headed out to local restaurant for food. We had breakfast in hotel each morning , good value and choice of hot and cold food again very friendly and helpful woman serving us she even gave us freshly boiled water for our tea as machine only gives very hot water! Important for those who like their tea i.e the Irish. Bedroom good size ,excellent bathroom, great shower, v large bed ( if a little firm ), good air conditioning and v quiet. Spotless also! Reception staff were helpful, courteous, gave us plenty maps, recommended places to see, advised how to get there, recommended restaurants including excellent Tapas bar around corner near Picasso museum. A special mention for the lady on reception who gave me a loan of a phone charger for the week as I brought the wrong one with me! Free internet on first floor plus printer, busy but had no bother getting on the few times we needed to. Small pool on roof terrace good for chilling out in evening after a day sightseeing in temps of 32 to 35 deg. Plenty seats and tables to relax with food drinks etc. Great week in Barca if a little too hot for sightseeing! We would highly recommend Ciutat!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a great location with really good outdoor space”
Reviews.Author: Thefriendlytourist
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel due to location and the pool area and it satisfied our needs perfectly. It is within easy walking distance of all the bars/restaurants and shops in the Born and Gothic quaters and also near to the zoo, a really nice park and the beach. We travelled as a couple with a teenager and found lots to keep us all entertained. The free internet cafe was great (when we could get on it - always busy) and the pool area was an ideal place to chill out on returning from a day out. There are tables and chairs on the roof area too where you can take your own food or just sit with a bottle of wine. Our room was small but had everything we needed. We were in a room on the first floor overlooking the road and bins, but had no problem with noise. The shower was particurlarly good. The staff were helpful and met our expectations on all accounts. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: stereoamy
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe this hotel got any bad reviews at all after my visit there! I learned a tip that when booking, especially through third party agencies (such as booking.com) if you specify in the comments box any preferences you are more likely to be given the room you want, rather than leaving it to chance on the day...so how delighted i was when we turned up and were given a room with a balcony and amazing view, and absolutely huge bed! The rooms are modern and clean, basic decor which keeps it fresh and cool in the day time. The aircon in our particular room was fantastic, the balcony doors have to be closed for it to work, which took a little time to figure out... but makes sense really! It's in an amazing location, the road it is on cuts directly into La Ramblas and there is a metro stop less than a 5 minute walk away. It is an easy distance from the port and all local attractions are easily reachable. We didn't eat any food in the hotel, but I don't see why you would when on holiday in such a fantastic city, which so many beautiful restaurants locally! I think that having an outward facing room definitely made a difference to our stay, so it is definitely worth stating you would prefere a balcony room whilst booking, Staff weren't the friendliest in the world, but we weren't there to stop and chat all day. A great little pool on the roof sealed the deal. Clean, modern, value for money, would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small rooms and HARD beds”
Reviews.Author: vinotravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location within the Barrio Gothic District, an easy walk to las Ramblas (did not take 35 min as stated in other review?) and close to many of the major sight seeing attractions in Barcelona. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated with a modern style but very small. The AC worked well and the staff was friendly and helpful. The one drawback with the rooms other than being small is that the beds are very hard. I am very well traveled and know you do not always find the most comfortable beds when traveling, but the beds here were some of the worst I have experienced. For this reason i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off by Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona & Booking.com”
Reviews.Author: jonManchester
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with booking.com for the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona, Worst NIGHTMARE HOTEL I have expereinced in my life: 1. Hotel is sold as being a short walk to Las Ramblas (35 minutes walk to be precise) 2. Hotel is featured as within walking distance to Plaza Catalyona (45 minutes walk to be precise) 3. AC did not work till 18.00hrs 4. Could not conect to free Internet connection in room even though hotel staff came to the room to try and fix the internet connection. 5. Tacky Cheap furniture in room but (Nice shower room) 6. Notice in lifts that pool area was out of use till 20th April 2009 (even though I checked in on 23rd April) 7. I made 2 bookings with booking.com for the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona one was for 1 night from 23rd April 2009 and an other booking for 2 nights from the 24th April 2009, however as I was so disgusted and disappointed by the hotel I used the booking.com website to modify my 2nd reservation from 2 nights to 1 night as I checked out on the hotel at 18.00hrs on the 24th April as I could not stand an other night there. booking.com sent me a confirmed modified reservation with the new cancallation policy however the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona still charged for the full amount even though on the booking.com modified reservation it clearly stated that if cancelled or no show only 1 night will be charged. 8. To add insult to injury booking.com just refused to get involved and keep sending me emails to deal with the hotel direct for my refund. I am now in the process of taking legal action against the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona & booking.com as I still have not been refunded on my credit card the extra night's charge by the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona. 9. booking.com are now not even repling to my emails.

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice but unfortunately they deceive the customers with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jmt12london
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Barcelona where I stayed for 7 nights. Unfortunately, the hotel blatantly cheats customers. To my greatest shock and displeasure I found out when checking out that breakfast (a steep EUR 10.75) was not included in the bill. When making my booking I was told that breakfast was included and at no point before or during my stay it was mentioned that I would have to pay for breakfast separately. If I had know I would have gone to a better and cheaper place to have breakfast. Funnily enough, at the same time, another guest was complaining about the very same thing so it is obviously not an isolated case. I complained to the manager, but in vain. I think the behaviour of the manager and hotel staff was outrageous and I have decided to report the hotel. Shame really, as apart from that, we had a very nice stay but this was cancelled by their deceipt.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing with broken heating and very uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: M1ssyM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to all the great reviews that I saw online but was so disappointed when we arrived. The room is basic and so uncomfortable, basic I can cope with but it felt more like a prison cell than a cosy bedroom for our three night stay. It is March 2009 and its been the coldest winter in Spanish history the heating has apparently been switched off!! Although, we know realize that this a euphemism for "itś not working but we can be bothered to tell you or fix it!" We live in Southern Spain and still have our heating on at home at the moment especially at night because it getś very cold so it concerned me to find just a sheet on the bed and one paper thin pillow each. We did find one thin extra blanket which we put on the bed and also turned on the heating for the first night which only seemed to pump out cold air all night even though it was on the heat setting! I woke up freezing cold and in agony due to the prison type bed. I had a bath and approached the hotel staff they told me it would be looked at and to inquire when we got back to the hotel. We did so and were told that the heating had been switched off due to it being ¨that time of year" and "not being able to please everyone" and all they could do was offer us more blankets which as the only option because by the way we had already had to pay for our entire stay on arrival after booking on the website online. We took two extra blankets which made a total of three and managed a slightly warmer night but still very uncomfortable. The room also has no natural light whatsoever so even though we were on the first floor it feels more like a basement. If I had known that we would have to pay the total upfront I would never have booked here. We I will never do this again because basically your stuffed with having to stay somewhere you are entirely unhappy with. Reception were unhelpful and having read other reviews we realise that this hotel appears to have no heating at all so they were also not telling us the truth which aggravates me even more. I asked them why did not let guests know the heating did not work instead of letting them have the discomfort of putting merely a sheet on the bed and not telling them the heating/air conditioning only pumps out cold air! I will not be staying here ever again and will be sending a complaint letter as soon as I get home the hotels one and I mean one saving grace is itś location. That is about it!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and incompetent personnel; broken heating”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon_Lux
Reviews.Content: The good ratings of this hotel on tripadvisor.com were one of the reasons for me to choose this hotel for a getaway of 5 days at the end of December 2008 with my girl-friend. This may well be my worst hotel experience so far, and this is also the reason for me to write this review. During the first night, we noticed that the heating was broken, i.e. that the air-conditioning was producing only cold, but no warm air. For that night , we pulled on some pullovers to be able to get at least some sleep. In the morning I informed the rather unfriendly guy at the reception (refusing by the way to speak English or any language other than Spanish) who told me that they would take care of the matter. During the second night, the heating did still not work, and it was cold again. I then went down to the reception, asking for another room, or someone fixing the problem - the receptionist for the night-shift informed me that no other room was available but that he could give me two or three additional blankets for the night - and that someone would take care of the problem the other day. Again, this did not happen. So I went a third time to the reception, asking for someone to check - the again very unfriendly guy at the reception gave me the same answer "Si, si..." I insisted that someone would check the heating right now, in my presence, to which the guy replied that it had been checked and that it worked perfectly - after 10 minutes of discussion he called someone to check with me in my room. The heating was (indeed) broken. They promised to fix it, and in the afternoon, the heating worked - unfortunately it did not work anymore during the night, which gave us a third night in the cold. The other day, I asked for another room, threatening to leave the hotel. So finally, we could sleep at least two of the 5 nights in a warm room. Besides the fact that we were not the only people complaining about the heating and that the hotel seems to have a serious problem with it, what angered me more is the way this was handled by the hotel. The personnel at the reception, and especially one Spanish guy for the morning shift was not only unfriendly, but at times even impertinent. The rooms were OK, and clean. Breakfast did not give a huge amount of choice, but was OK. Less OK was the fact that on the last day we had to wait 15 minutes before having a clean plate (no it's self-service, but no clean plates in the breakfast room). The hotel has 2 PC's with Internet access on the first floor - when we were there, one of the two PC's was broken (so was also one of the chairs lacking one wheel...) Overall conclusion: I hope and firmly believe that there are better hotels in Barcelona. Please avoid this hotel for your own sake.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place, but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Ciutat in Barcelona in November, mostly on the basis of TripAdvisor Reviews. Overall I'd say it was a very good choice with 2 caveats, 1 major and 1 minor. The hotel has an outstanding location - literally a few feet from the PIcasso Museum in the Old City, a 5 minute walk from the Cathedral and a ten minute walk from Plaza Catalunya. There are tons of restaurants, bars, etc within a short walk. The lobby is small but pleasant, and secured after-hours. It is fairly modern and sleek. The hotel has 2 elevators, 2 computers with free internet access, and free bottled water for guests. There is a breakfast room but we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel. The staff speaks very good English and are helpful and professional. They requested a taxi for me on departure and gave me some good restaurant suggestions as well. The room was ready upon our arrival at 9 am, which was very nice. We had requested a crib in advance and they had the crib in the room, also very nice. Our room was a corner room on the main street (C/ de Princessa) with 2 large beautiful windows and a small, pleasant balcony overlooking the street. The room was floored in Pergo and did feel a bit like it was Ikea-furnished. The double bed is two single beds pushed together, but that was not a problem. The TV gets about 20 channels, about 2 in English. There is a safe in the room, no refrigerator. The room was a decent size for Europe, average to small by American standards. The bathroom was fine, the standard weird Spanish half-shower door thing which I've never understood, good water pressure and good lighting. The counter around the sink is too small and doesn't hold enough toiletries for 2-3 people. As for the caveats: Caveat #1 (minor): the beds are extremely firm. I mean almost rock hard, and I like firm beds. As I am a side-sleeper, this was a little tough to get used to and over 4 nights I had a sore neck several times. Caveat #2 (major): Our room was quite noisy. It faces onto C/ de Princessa, which is a single-lane, one-way street but a significant artery for the east side of the Old City. It's not that the street was actually so noisy; however, because the buildings are so close together, the street seemed to act as a reverbatory cavity, amplifying the sounds of voices, cars, scooters, recycling being dumped in the bins, and trash trucks/street cleaners coming through, especially at night. If you are a heavy sleeper or have a very good set of earplugs, this is not a problem. However, for our infant, it was a major problem, and therefore, it became a major problem for us! She woke up every night at 2 am (as people started coming home from bars and restaurants) and couldn't get back to sleep. We didn't ask for a quieter room, thinking we'd get used to it over the few days, but we never did. I'm not sure if there are rooms NOT on the main street but I would be sure to request one if you are at all a light sleeper. Overall we enjoyed this hotel and in particular the location simply cannot be beat. However, make sure you bring earplugs or look into the possibility of a substantially quieter room. We would come back if we could be sure of a quieter night.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCann-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel different from the rest is the customer service, value for money and location. We looked at other hotels during our stay and were pleased with this choice. Barcelona is a very busy city and if you like the busy city (outrageous prices) experience then this place is for you. Taxis Transfer We took a taxi from the airport and he drove like Nigel Mansell My mum was actually sick when we arrived at the hotel . Our return taxi was no better and both charged excessive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunniekate
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay when planning a last minute road trip to Barcelona. This hotel is in the Born area and it's near beautiful restuarants and shops and close to the subway. The hotel is small, no parking, but has every moden amenity - flat screen cable tv, modern decor, spaciuos rooms and clean/modern bathrooms. they have comlimentary computers and internet service on the second floor which is a nice perk and a pool top roof (it's small but pretty, we didn't get to try it out). The desk staff and cleaning crew were very nice and helpful. We paid 99 euros a night which was great for this place. I would certainly stay here and again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights stay 27/09/08”
Reviews.Author: Angellica_Sta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights. Had really good time over there. Get taxi from airport to the hotel paid €27.00 euro for two people. The staff in the hotel was very nice and helpful. The room wasn't too big but was modern and was with balcony overlooking the city. Thought it's gonna to be noisy during night but it wasn't and it was great.The hotel located just 10 min walking distance to La Ramblas and 20 min to the beach, 7 min to the Zoo. Hotel has free internet facilities so we could check our emails and print the tickets they day we went home. The terrace on the roof is great and very romantic. There was nobody there around 1am so we went there drinking champagne and enjoying the great weather and company of each other. The water in the pool was cold so didn't really enjoy it. Even day time it's not warm. It's great they provide bottles of water free of charge just the fridge was at the back of the corridor so we didn't see the first night. Probably it's our mistake. Make sure you iron all your clothes as one night we went for dinner and I wanted to iron my dress so I ring to reception around 8.30pm but I was told that they do not provide iron to the room. I offer to pay for it but receptionist refuse to give it to me saying that i have to give my dress and housekeepers will iron it to me. I didn't mind... just it took them 24 hours to do it :) so I never wear the dress that night. And they charge about 10 euro. After all I was happy with the hotel and would recommend it to someone who wants to be minutes to La Ramblas and who like modern style. I booked the hotel through centrlr.com and it cost me €160.00 per night for two people with room only rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Densel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is clean & comfortable. The rooms are certainly not big but we are talking about the centre of Barcelona. For the price €120 per night, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The free bottles of water were fully appreciated. The Staff let us leave our luggage in the hotel for some time after checkout as we wanted to spend some more time in Barcelona. The rooms are air-conditioned although I switched it off due to the noise. The only real negative was the Breakfast. A group of Germans had arrived and as they do, really took over, the staff were simply unable to cope. We had to comeback a further two times before there was any space and food, even then we had to ask several times for cereals and juice. Overall, I would definitely check out the rates & availability of this hotel on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a nice part of Barcelona. Rooms are basic, seemed to entirely furnished by IKEA judging by my room but OK for what you pay. Clean rooms, helpful staff. Free bottles of water in the corridor is a nice touch. Will stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: worthington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ciutat Hotel for one night preceding our Mediterranean Cruise leaving out of Barcelona. The hotel provided a perfect location to explore the city on foot. In addition, it provided a locked luggage room, so we were able to store luggage before and after check in/check out times. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions, transportation, and restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToffeeKat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ciutat de Barcelona for a birthday break, so I was very pleased that this hotel was everything i had expected. Room was very clean, with a balcony which was a nice relief being in a city.Last hotel we stayed at was lovely but very claustraphobic due to lack of view and balcony, which a lot of places are like in barcelona. Had been to Barcelona once before and really wanted to stay in the Gothic quarter this time due to the accessability to the rest of the city from there, and also the great atmosphere. Hotel is 10min walk through gothic qtr. to the Rambla, and 5min walk to the Ciutadella Parc which is gorgeous. Very good to have free bottles of water on hand, especially good after a night out when the shops are shut. Jaume 1 metro about 100m away, so had easy access to entire city. Recommend this hotel for access to Gothic Quarter, beaches, Picasso museum, Cathedral and Port. However with a metro stop so close, it is easy to get anywhere in the city from here. Pool on roof nice touch, although small. Didn't get a chance to use it though as there are only 5 or 6 beds and we are not early risers! Didn't have breakfast at hotel, but the rooftop breakfast terrace looked lovely. All in all, a nice modern clean hotel in the heart of barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie100
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this hotel in mid August and couldn't find fault with it at all. The hotel is wonderfully located in a lovely area and very close to the metro (which is brilliant and cheap). The air con was very good, the shower superb, the room clean, airy and extremely well insulated for sound and light. We had breakfast up on the roof every day and it was a lovely way to start the day. We also made use of the little pool and rooftop sun terrace every day, a real bonus in a city centre hotel. The staff were helpful and pleasant. Excellent all round, we wouldn't think of going anywhere else next time we go to Barcelona. Worth mentioning that we had a wonderful Indian meal at the Kama restaurant in the Born area, and a wonderful Italian meal at Caputxes, also in Born ( we got a bit of tapas fatigue!) All of Barcelona was great but we particularly loved Casa Mila, the cable car up Montjuic, the magic fountain and just sitting at the edge of the walkway at Port Vell and watching the huge fish in that twinkling blue sea. Bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: scotrodg
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here as a belated wedding anniversary break. When we got to the hotel the welcome was friendly and the reception staff all spoke English. When we got to our room we were really pleased by it, whilst not big it was sufficient and VERY clean. The toilet/shower room was also spotless and very well appointed. Breakfast was a buffet with Hot and Cold items available, plenty of juice, but tea and coffee was only available from a (free) vending machine and proved to be somewhat poor in quality. However there was a good selection of food available and every thing that we had was very good. The hotel provided complementary bottles of chilled water to guests so that you could take a couple of small bottles or maybe a larger bottle in a backpack, or both I suppose in really hot weather. The hotel is located in a very quiet lane only a few minutes from the top of the Ramblas, the lane was dimly lit at nights but we did not find it too intimidating. I would find it hard to find fault with this hotel although I must concede that it had only been opened for around one year when we visited so everything looked very fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but 'apartment' disappointing”
Reviews.Author: breakfast4two
Reviews.Content: My husband and I we were keen to stay in the Bari Gothic district and booked an apartment which we mistakenly thought was part of the actual hotel. However, when checking in we learnt that the apartment was in a separate building in one of the back streets about 300 metres away from the main hotel. This would not have worried us greatly except that our apartment block had no lift (this was not mentioned in the description on the website) and the staircase was very impractical - very steep and extremely narrow - not what you would expect in a 3 star hotel. In addition, our 'two-bedroom' apartment was no more than a small one-bedroom with another room that served as a bedroom, kitchen and dining room all squashed into one! Luckily, there were only the 2 of us so this was not a major issue but given that we had paid for a 'two-bedroom apartment' we expected a lot more for our money. We hate to imagine how more people would have stayed without living on top of each other! On the plus side, the location was fabulous giving us an opportunity to expereince life in the old quarter of Barcelona. Luckily we only had to rely on the hotel breakast for one morning as it was unimpressive with little variety and lack of service. Overall, an average hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonnefov
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms in excellent location Breakfast was ample and is now taken on the terrace, which is very pleasant Metro station is close and Princesa is nice shopping street with bars and restaurants close by Ice cream shop opposite the hotel is the best in Barcelona! Staff mostly helpful-but had some problems getting extra pillows and reconfirming trabnsfers from airport I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: wbstauffer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20's and recently travelled around Spain. We thought this was an excellent hotel. The rooms were very clean and we thought they were quite spacious compared to other hotel rooms in other cities we had recently visited. It was hard to find inexpensive rooms in Barcelona, but we thought this was a fair price for the room. Our room was bright and open and had a nice balcony overlooking the street. There were computers with free internet, which was really nice. The pool and sundeck were also great additions. In the halls, they had refrigerators full of bottled water for guests, which I had never seen in Europe. The neighborhood in which this hotel is located, is excellent and we spent most evenings walking around and eating at nearby tapas bars. If you are looking for something quaint and charming, you might not be impressed with this hotel, but if you need a nice clean room in a great area, this is a great choice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jellybean024
Reviews.Content: great position in the gothic quarter. 2 mins from the picasso museum. Bars and restaurants within strolling distance. 5 mins from the train station. Clean hotel and very friendly staff. Restaurant was closed on evening in hotel as they were refurbishing.,however they were still doing breakfast which was good. Top tip if you are a brit take your travel kettle! as tea was horrid. But thats a minor gripe. Definately worth staying at

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: jeffliv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in much higher rated but this was without exception the best stay I have ever had anywhere. The rooms are not huge but funky and especially clean. We stayed on the second floor not over looking the street and it was as quiet as could be. The 2 best things about this place are the pool and the gallons of free minerakl water. I've styed in places where neither of these would be considered a luxury but in a big city like Barcelona they were a godsend. The good lady and me went for our anniversary in September 07 and quickly found the pool after after arriving in mid afternoon. We had an excellent lunch at the restaurant and headed to the terrace to find it moderately busy. The full day of sightseeing on our 2nd day was become difficult in the heat so we headed back to the hotel at around 12 lunchtime. We'd decided to spend the afternoon lounging around the pool if it was'nt too busy so we made our way up there armed with gallons of the free mineral water. The fact that we found the terrace empty and were left undisturbed for 5 hours will remain as the best afternoon of my life. We'd left the kids with grandparents and this time was bliss. The fact that you could chill out to this level yet still be in the middle of a bustling city is one heck of an achievement. the location is superb, the rooms excellent, restaurant top drawer, the pool beyond description and the net access a welcome addition. Could not reccomend highly enough, just don't force the prices up!

Reviews.Title: “"In A Bind"”
Reviews.Author: SeenMyKeyz
Reviews.Content: We were finishing a Med Cruise in Barcelona and decided to stay an extra day but it also happened to be the weekend of the Spanish Grand Prix and there were no hotels available and many required a 3 night minimum. I kept emailing several hotels and the Ciutat de Barcelona wrote back indicating they had a cancelation and would allow us to stay just the one night. We arrived early AM and they stored our luggage until our room was open... the room did not have a balcony and was a bit on the small side. We noticed another room facing Calle Princessa that the maid was cleaning and asked if we could wait for it. They agreed and mentioned that it might be a little noisier because it was street side... it wasn't with the door closed. There was only minimum outside street noise which was great. We were on the 4th floor and both the room and bathroom was clean and neat. Additional comments... the pool area on the top of the hotel is cute and quiet, there was a hall cooler with free water bottles, and free internet service on the second floor. The rate was $388 US but this was during the Grand Prix. The room rates are regularly around $290 US. We would stay there again... close to Las Ramblas, Bari Goti, and easy access to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but IKEA like rooms”
Reviews.Author: beatrix75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights last week. Overall it wasn't a bad expereience at all but I'd look for somewhere else next time round. On the plus side, the location is the best, so close to Barri Gotico, Rambla and metro, yet on a relatively quiet street. Also very clean and free water and Internet access. On the negative, the rooms are small even for European standards and very IKEA like, as in very cheap modern-style furniture and plastic accessories. The bath was a let-down, being only a half size one. The noise insulation is not great and the cleaners doing up the rooms at 4 pm wasn't great either! The hotel was quiet expensive for the standard it offered. I've since seen a couple of 3 star hotels in similar great location at 40 EUROS less per night.

Reviews.Title: “wish I was still at the ciutata de barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: holidayaddict23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on a short break to Brcelona. The hotel was in a great location. An easy walk to the bustling La Rambla and main shopping area, lined with bars, restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques. It was the easiest journey from airport to hotel I have ever made. Barely 5 mins from Estacio de Franca train station which is the end of the line so you can't go wrong. Plus for some reason, tourist tickets were free, so our journey to and from the airport cost us absolutely nothing. The hotel decor was lovely and modern. Very clean with a good bathroom. Staff were helpful and the breakfast was varied with several options. I am only sorry I am not still there but I have already reccommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 Star Hotel with nice extras”
Reviews.Author: VP1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights at the end of January on our first ever trip to Barcelona. We realised later what a fantastic location we had picked - that is the major plus point for this hotel. It's surrounded by lots of lovely bars, restaurants and shops and only 5 mins walk from Estacio de Franca which has direct trains to/from the airport. The hotel itself was an excellent 3-star hotel - rooms are good with all the facilities and the bed was a really good king size. We were originally offered a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street but it only had a (big) shower and as I wanted a bath they moved us to another room which faced onto a courtyard. This actually worked out best for us as it was completely quiet and I would imagine the rooms at the front would have noise quite late into the night. The terrace and pool area are beautiful and I imagine they are great in the summer - although the weather was lovely in January it wasn't quite swimming weather! We had dinner in the restaurant one night and the food was good and reasonably priced - my husband's main meal was a bit on the nouvelle cuisine side but tasted nice. We didn't try breakfast at the hotel - we found loads of nice cafes nearby for coffee and a sandwich. The only downside to the hotel is that you can't get a drink or anything from the restaurant outside of restaurant opening hours - we asked reception if we could have a glass of wine to take up to our room at about 7pm but they said we couldn't get one until the restaurant opened at 8pm. They seem to have strict rules as the night we ate at the restaurant we ordered a cocktail at 11.15pm but were told we couldn't have cocktails until 11.30pm - by which time we couldn't get the attention of a waiter to order one! Anyway, apart from those little niggles, it is a superb hotel for the price - and the location is fantastic. Barcelona itself was fabulous - easily my favourite city destination beating New York and Paris - highlights were definitely Parc Guell and Sagrada Famillia. Downside was we had our camera stolen on the first day but our fault for not being more vigilant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location - Im going back!”
Reviews.Author: jjm79
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel in September 07. We both really enjoyed it. We both had single rooms which were compact but fine for a city break, and not bad compared to other hotels Ive stayed in, in Barcelona. Its reasonably priced and although relatively basic, its very clean and pretty stylish. As with the bedrooms, the bathrooms were compact but nice - although one room had only a shower, which was fine for me, but if you fancy a bath youd better request one. As with most hotels in a bustling city like this, there is a fair bit of noise outside both late at night and early in the morning. This wasnt a problem in one of our rooms which was on the upper floors, but it may be an inconvenience if youre staying on a lower floor and are a light sleeper. Still, as i say, this would be typical of a lot of hotels in the city. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly and free internet access (with printer), along with complimentary bottled water in fridges on every floor, were real bonuses. Unfortunately we didnt eat in the hotel so i cant comment on the restaurant. The location is great, being both close to the tourist attractions of the Ramblas and old town and also handy to Barceloneta and the Port area. Jaume metro station is 5mins walk. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants in short walking distance and the surrounding narrow ancient streets give the feeling that youre having an authentic Barcelona experience. Id definately recommend the hotel for anyone on a short city break and Im booked to go back next week on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: LaBernardi
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance and how lucky we were! Just down the street from the Picasso Museum in the up and coming Born district, the location is perfectly located for walking and buses, easy to get to if your are coming in from Girona or walking in the Gothic quarter or close to the port. The hotel is modern, clean and essential with everything needed: hairdryer, flat screen TV with satellite in three languages, internet in-room and two computer stations and printer on the first floor. The staff is service oriented and friendly. Breakfast at the restaurant Colors next door was add-on but included croissants, bacon and eggs, cheese, cereals, fresh fruit and juices,etc. We stayed five nights (family of four) and ate there every day. We dined one night at Colors: excellent and well priced food and great local wine list. In sum this is home away from home...a great hotel and we travel a lot!!! Problems: small towels and the bed was a bit hard for our taste. Stay at this hotel you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fabri
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the hotel with my wife. We were given a double room facing on the pedestrian road Carrer Princessa which is lively but not noisy as other streets in this wonderful city. The quarter El Born-Ribera is one of the most authentic, far from the mass touristic Ramblas, full of bar, taparias, restaurants and typical shops (there area couple of pastry-makers close to the hotel). The room was clean and large, with a large bathroom. The reception was friendly and helpful. We were surprised by the breakfast in the lounge bar: rich and good, even if they charge you it is worth of the money you spend. The nearby Estacion de Francia leads you to the main railway station of Barcelona Sants and to the airport. I strongly recommend this hotel for a short or long break. You are ten minutes' pleasant walk far from the Ramblas and near to all major attractions. If not, take the underground at Jaume I, just one minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Classy city hotel”
Reviews.Author: moulinal5
Reviews.Content: Clean, bright, modern hotel in a traditional building in a narrow street. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the city centre (old and new) and the port area. Our room faced the front street and had a tiny balcony. Room decor was bright and modern, and the modern bathroom was huge! Excellent choice at breakfast, and the restaurant 'Colors' offers good value. Others have spoken about the bottled water and internet access provided - both plus points for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No windows to the sky”
Reviews.Author: frederikdejgaard
Reviews.Content: No natural light. With 2 views to 2 courtyards one from the bath and one from the bedroom. No refrigerator. But very central and clean except for a very big cockroach on our bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbug77717
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from spending 4 nights at the Ciutat and had an excellent experience there. We stayed in a large corner room facing the street. It was a little noisy at night, but not too bad. The room was sparsely furnished, yet very comfortable and the bathroom was large (especially for a bathroom in Europe!). The location of this hotel is excellent. It's very close to the Picasso museum (a must see) and it's one block from a metro stop, which is very convenient to take you to many of the sites. Las Ramblas is a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. There are several tasty restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. We were especially impressed with an Italian place called Murivecchi, just a block east of the hotel. Had excellent, authentic thin crust pizza there. If you love Italian food like we do, this place will rock your world. We were very pleased with the free bottled water in the refrigerators on every floor. And there are 2 computers with free internet access available to guests. The staff was very accomodating and helped us send faxes when business unfortunately intruded on our vacation... All in all, I would highly recommend this place. We would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: The reviews that precede this are all on point. This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are spacious and neat. Bathroom is modern. Location is superb - I came in from the Franca train station and had an easy walk to the hotel. It's within walking distance of many attractions including the Picasso museum (2 blocks), Las Ramblas, Sagrada Familia, the Born district, the marina and the warrens of the Gothic Quarter. I paid E125 per night. My only complaint is there is no in room internet access and the 2 common use computers were often occupied. Oh well...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mr_swingIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ciutat is a nice place, well worth the price. We stayed there with my wife for three nights, the room was well-designed in a modern way, was clean and neat. Location is central, in Barri Gotic, less than 10 min. to Rambla, and to a near Bus touristic stop, to main train station. The breakfast was cool.People were firendly. It has a cosy terrace with a small pool. Very preferable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Ciutat”
Reviews.Author: foxseven
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and sincere staff, well and modern equipped rooms and a beautiful terrace with a small pool on the top of the hotel. Our group of 22 swiss people stayed for three nights in this perfect priced three star hotel. The location and the service is very good for the money we've spent! A big thank to Marta and the rest of the staff at the Ciutat de Barcelona for helping us for this unforgettable weekend in Barcelona.
